intro: Lotononis lenticula, commonly known as the lens-shaped lotonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its unique morphology includes a short, thick stem and waxy foliage that helps reduce water loss. The flowers are usually pale green to reddish in color, attracting various pollinators such as bees and flies.
